alert.note: Alert for North Snowy Range Foothills (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 08 at 3:12AM MST until February 09 at 6:00AM MST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 2 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 6 AM MST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 3 inches. Winds gusting as high as 65 mph. * WHERE...North Snowy Range Foothills including Interstate 80 near Arlington and Elk Mountain. * WHEN...From 2 PM this afternoon to 6 AM MST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be difficult. Falling and blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility at times. Wind chills as low as 20 degrees below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
